summary: This bill, the NIH Reform Act, proposes to split the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) into three separate institutes: the National Institute of Allergic Diseases, the National Institute of Infectious Diseases, and the National Institute of Immunologic Diseases. It outlines the reorganization, appointment of directors (requiring Senate confirmation), and specifies the duties of each new institute.  It also includes conforming amendments to existing legislation and calls for an orderly transition of authority.
